DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to analyze pathologic and radiologic characteristics of mediastinal lymph nodes with false positive FDG PET/CT results in lung cancer staging and assess relationship between false positive mediastinal lymph node and TB/latent TB.
DOC.brief_title: Characteristics of Mediastinal Lymph Node With False Positive FDG PET/CT Results in Lung Cancer Staging : Relation With TB and Latent TB Infection
DOC.criteria: age 2075, men and women person who performed PET/CT and surgical biopsy of mediastinal lymph node for diagnosis of primary lung cancer of metastatic lung cancer age < 20 person who don't agree with enrollment illiterate person who is diagnosed as active tuberculosis now person who has history of hypersensitivity on PPD (tuberculin purified protein derivative) pregnant woman person who is treated as active tuberculosis
DOC.keyword: mediastinal lymph node with false positive FDG PET/CT results in lung cancer staging
